ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: There were also virtual meetings with tutors to improve our pronunciation.

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: How to speak, read, and listen to Chinese
I learned how to hold very basic conversations in Mandarin.

I learned how to communicate in basic Mandarin. Most of the speaking was more casual and conversational but fundamental to the Mandarin language. I also learned how to write Chinese characters and correctly identify and pronounce tones. In general, I learned how to study and to learn a new language, but it was challenging at first.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths:
- Very engaging due to the amount of work assigned
- Teachers were quick to learn and adapt to unusual circumstances throughout the semester

Weaknesses:
- I would have liked more feedback on the Quia quizzes

I think that this was a very strong course. I learned many of the fundamentals of the language. This class was very engaging, and the environment was very ideal for learning a new language. I think of the weaknesses was that writing characters was not an emphasized part of the course as much as the other parts, which may have been due to the changes made to the course due to COVID-19. I think making the "writing" portion of the test mandatory for every test would be more beneficial in ensuring students learn the characters.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
- The virtual classes were very engaging as everyone is prompted to speak regularly
- I really like that everyone needs their camera on so that the teacher could see us pronounce words
- Regular small assignments on Canvas made sure that students did not procrastinate. In other classes, I had longer and less frequent ones, which when combined with the classes being virtual, made it really easy for me to fall behind.

I think the online lectures were great under the circumstances. However, I do think that the oral test could have been improved. It was a hard test. Even though I studied, it was difficult for me to perform at my best when the timer was running, causing me to stress out before the next question if I had messed up the previous one.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes because it helps you learn chinese
Yes, the course is taught by excellent teachers. Would recommend for those who are committed to spend a lot of time learning outside of class.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. This course is a great introduction to Mandarin as a language. The content is overwhelming at first; however, the language gets easier to pronounce as the more it's learned. This is also a great way to challenge academic discipline when it comes to homework and work load.
This a very well taught course but its super hard. I wish I took it during my first few years at Yale and not during a pandemic!
